Comments_List: I think this was a good experience, and helped me to get a sense for what my fellow graduate students are working on while learning skills in presenting my science.
Gained experience presenting my work and learned about the diverse projects ongoing in the MCDB department.

I think the evaluation forms are a good idea and help to keep everyone engaged. I also think the Friday symposiums versus every Friday meetings are a good adjustment. I didn't really see a major issue with the course--Watson A60 was too small for the last meeting, but that was probably an unavoidable issue. Also, a description of the structure of the talks for the second years could be more explicit.

I preferred the weekly Friday morning sessions and think it would be easier to focus on fewer presentations at a time, rather than many in one afternoon. But I do know this was the less popular choice when we voted!
Yes - it is a good way to hear about other students' work and practice active listening
